content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-049-16-A |Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty |Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty |Rank=A |Title=Defining delayed puberty in boys and girls |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors= |Order=16}} Delayed puberty is defined as the absence of breast development after the age of 13 in a girl or testicular enlargement after the age of 14 in a boy.

question.question: At what age is delayed puberty typically diagnosed in girls and boys, respectively?
question.option_a: Absence of breast development after age 12 in girls and testicular enlargement after age 13 in boys
question.option_b: Absence of breast development after age 13 in girls and testicular enlargement after age 14 in boys
question.option_c: Absence of breast development after age 14 in girls and testicular enlargement after age 15 in boys
question.option_d: Absence of breast development after age 12 in girls and testicular enlargement after age 15 in boys
